<< subsindex elementary functions swapbytes >>

sum

Sum of array elements.

Syntax

R = sum(M)
R = sum(M, d)
R = sum(M, d)
R = sum(M, d, t)
R = sum(M, d, t, f)

Input argument

M

an array of double, single, integers, ...

d

dimension to operate along: positive integer scalar.

t

a string: 'default', 'double' or 'native'.

f

a string: 'includenan' or 'omitnan'.

Output argument

R

Sum of array elements.

Description

R = sum(M) returns the sum of the array elements of M.

Example

M = uint8([10:30:70;20:30:80;30:30:90]);
R = sum(M, 'native')

See also

ndims, prod.

History

Version Description
1.0.0 initial version

Author

Allan CORNET
